name: URL and email detector
content:
foo@demo.net <-- link
bar.ba@test.cokkkk <-- link
bar.ba@test.com <-- link
bar.ba@google.ventures <-- link
Hello don't link this.
I am Dave.Noo I am not. <-- don't link this
whatever.com <-- don't link this, only if www and/or protocol:// precedes it
a.whatever.com <-- don't link.
http://a.whatever.com <-- link
http://google.ventures <--- Allow new TLDs
www.demo.com <-- link
Have you checked http://foo.co.uk/? <-- don't pick up last ?
Have you checked http://foo.co.uk? <-- don't pick up last ?
Yes, I've checked http://foo.com. <-- don't pick up last .
http://regexr.com/foo.html?q=bar <-- link whole thing.
http://regexr.com/foo.html?q=bar. <-- don't pick up last .
http://regexr.com/foo.html?q=foo.bar. <-- don't pick up last . even if technically valid.
www.foo.com?asd <-- we should match this
www.foo.com?q=something <-- and this
www.foo.com/?q=something <-- and this
http:/www.foo.com <-- just link the valid part is fine.

This is a http://url.com\but then ends. <-- stop at the unsupported \ char.
This is a http://url.com$ but then ends. <-- stop at the unsupported char.

ftp://whatever.com <-- link

abc://rad <-- fine to link.
abc:/rad <-- don't link.

This is a line.
And another line. <-- don't link the two lines.

Screenshot: http://d.pr/i/1kkDd
author: @DaveNotik
